attributes.action: want the historic bandstand in Royal Tunbridge Wells Kent to be preserved
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
THE FOCAL point of Calverley Grounds in Tunbridge Wells is under imminent threat of demolition.

The bandstand survived bombing during the second world war but now seems likely to be torn down by Tunbridge Wells Borough Council.

Cabinet members agreed to bulldoze the historic structure – pending planning permission – and it could go by as early as June.
Royal Tunbridge Wells Civic Society has labelled the decision "shameful" and a sign of a "lack of civic pride".

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "want the historic bandstand in Royal Tunbridge Wells Kent to be preserved."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page20316


Prime Minister's Office
